channel.title: How do i make the thieving stalls give more exp?
channel.description: How do i make the thieving stalls give more exp on deltascape it only gives 20exp per thieve. Add my msn tylerhill_thebest_goalie@hotmail.com or repliy and tell me and thank you.

item.title: How do i make the thieving stalls give more exp?
item.dc:creator: @loggedout loggedout
item.description:
@loggedout wrote:

or if its not a 317 try editing this bit

if(objectID == 2562){
TheifStall(“gem stall”, “and recieve 150k”, 80, (EXP)*playerLevel[17], 995, 150000, 0x340);

edit the exp to wat ever value you want it to be,

thanks hope this helps,

Read full topic
item.source: How do i make the thieving stalls give more exp?

item.title: How do i make the thieving stalls give more exp?
item.dc:creator: @Lin Lin
item.description:
@Lin wrote:

If it’s a 317 server, just use MoparScape and find the stall’s object id. Then search in client.java…
case object id:

And the action for the click is between that and the nearest break;. Just change the xp given, like ThievingXP += 20; or somethin.

Read full topic
item.source: How do i make the thieving stalls give more exp?

item.title: How do i make the thieving stalls give more exp?
item.dc:creator: @Benz Benz
item.description:
@Benz wrote:

[quote=“RuneScapeWPS, post:3, topic:250117”]Open up your Client.Java, and just search for “20”, and keep clicking NEXT until you find something like this

give.Exp("20")} }

Something like that, and just change it to any value.[/quote]

“give” isn’t a class in common servers, and by using give.Exp(String) you’re trying to access a method within class “give”. Then, the experience value wouldn’t be a string (Strings enclosed within quotation marks), they would more than likely be integers.

So no, that wouldn’t work.

Read full topic
item.source: How do i make the thieving stalls give more exp?

Open up your Client.Java, and just search for “20”, and keep clicking NEXT until you find something like this

give.Exp("20")} }

Something like that, and just change it to any value.
